author: BRAD BUGGER For the Journal
title: Former St. John’s Catholic Campus Ministry Director David O'Neill dies of cancer | Local | idahostatejournal.com
text: POCATELLO — Those who serve in religious ministries can spend a lot of time counseling others how to best carry out their faith. But for David O’Neill, he was able to be a walking example of how to live his faith. O’Neill, 41, who served as the director of the St. John’s Catholic Campus Ministry at Idaho State University, passed away Wednesday after a four-year battle with cancer. He leaves behind Saeward, his wife of 16 years, and his three children, Liam, Killian and Ellie. Throughout his cancer trials, O’Neill showed the Catholic community of ISU and all of Pocatello what faith looks like under the most trying of circumstances. He was first diagnosed with cancer four years ago, during the COVID-19 pandemic. Despite undergoing intensive chemotherapy and being “immuno-compromised,” he refused to shut down the St. John’s ministry during the pandemic. “He is committed to keeping the doors of St. John’s open so people can gather,” Kyle McGowan, a supporter of the student center and vice president of advancement for ISU, told the Idaho Catholic Register in 2022. “Everyone in the world would have given him the grace to stay home, but he didn’t do that.” Throughout his seven years of serving the St. John’s Community, O’Neill’s operating philosophy was “keeping the doors open” — especially to the student community who would wander into his office at the center, slip into the old, comfortable couch there and unload their life’s burdens on O’Neill. “I’ve always had an open-door policy in my office,” O’Neill said in a recent interview before his passing. “The door to my office was never closed. I wanted to communicate to the students that there’s really nothing I’ve got going on that’s more important than serving them. When students seized on those opportunities to come in and sit on the couch, which basically envelops you, they always said it was so comforting, inviting and that they felt safe here. Sharing life with these students taught me as much as I taught them. I received as much from them as I believe they received from me.” O’Neill, a native of Australia, spent most of his entire adult life in some form of ministry to the church and the community. He met his wife while serving on a National Evangelization Team (NET), which is made up of young people who give up nine months of their lives to work in parishes and schools, challenging young Catholics to encounter Christ through parish retreats and individual discipleship. He served on NET teams in Australia, Uganda and the United States. The couple were married in 2007 and moved to her hometown of Pocatello, where O’Neill became youth minister for Holy Spirit Catholic Community, a position he held for four years. Then he became director of Youth and Young Adult Ministry for the Catholic Diocese of Baker, Oregon from 2012 to 2015, followed by a stint as the director of the Catholic student center at the University of Idaho. When Pete Espil, the campus ministry director at St. John’s, became ill, O’Neill was asked by Idaho Bishop Peter Christensen to return to Pocatello to take on the ISU position. “David had a great impact on all who knew him,” said Father Emil Parafiniuk, the priest who served the St. John’s Community, and current pastor of Holy Spirit Catholic Community in Pocatello. “He was a great friend, father to many students and an active member of the community. We all miss him, our hearts are filled with pain, but we also believe that his life has changed, not ended.” O’Neill was first diagnosed with colon cancer in May of 2020. After a treatment regimen, he was briefly declared cancer free, but the disease returned, and in February of this year, he was forced to give up his position at St. John’s. In April of this year, he sat down again with the Idaho Catholic Register to talk about his battle, which he knew was coming to an end soon. He left the Pocatello Catholic community, indeed the entire Catholic community of Idaho, with an unflinching testimony to his faith and his belief in the ultimate salvation offered by that faith. “Through it all, I think, I’ve been able to witness joyfully to Jesus’ presence in my life,” O’Neill said. “The way I can continue to give it all back to Him, to serve Him faithfully, and to know that suffering is not, in a sense, a bad thing. It’s an opportunity to unite with Him on the cross, so I really have something to give Christ in His crucifixion.” O’Neill continued, “I’ve surrendered to His will. I believe He has an amazing plan, and who am I to question, or at least to say, ‘Can we do something different?’ even though it’s human nature to do that. I trust God, and I trust His faithfulness — that He has my best interests, my family’s best interests, at heart.” A vigil for O’Neill will be held from 7 to 8 p.m. on Monday at St. John’s Catholic Student Center, 917 E. Lovejoy St., in Pocatello. A Memorial Mass will be at 12 p.m. on Tuesday at the Holy Spirit Catholic Community Church, 524 N. Seventh Ave., in Pocatello. Inurnment to follow at Mountain View Cemetery.

本报讯（四川日报全媒体记者 陈俊伶）2025年3月12日是我国第47个植树节，四川省绿化委员会办公室当天发布2024年四川省国土绿化公报。公报显示，一年来，全省累计参与植树2560余万人次，义务植树8900余万株。2024年全省完成营造林522.49万亩，修复治理退化草原956.3万亩；巩固两轮退耕还林成果1600余万亩，改造低质低效退耕林60万亩，新建储备林50.3万亩；完成荒漠化土地治理73.82万亩，其中沙化土地55.71万亩、石漠化土地18.11万亩。
2024年，四川在古树名木保护方面取得显著成效。公报显示，2024年新增古树名木5967株，其中一级古树290株、名木1株。根据省政府公布的2024年四川省新增一级古树及名木名录，291株新增的一级古树名木中，千岁以上古树达15株，其中树龄最大的为1800岁，位于广元市昭化区王家镇金星村，为黄连木；新增的唯一一株名木为日本晚樱，位于乐山市沙湾区
铜;)河街道南陵社区。此外，2024年四川落实中省财政资金、中央专项彩票公益金5100万元支持翠云廊古柏等重点古树（群）抢救复壮，该金额较前一年的3600万元有大幅度提升。“针对争取到的更多资金，我们已聚焦重点区域古树名木做好实施方案，通过项目实施，不断改善古树生存环境，帮助有抢救复壮需求的古树得到有效保护。”省林草局生态保护修复处相关负责人说。
公报显示，2024年，四川共有12个古树群纳入全国古树群整体保护建设项目储备。记者了解到，广元市有4个，泸州市、绵阳市、雅安市各有2个，攀枝花市、遂宁市各有1个。

title: The shadow men who rescued the bodies of the abductees speak for the first time: "The families are our strength" - Voila! news - The Limited Times
text:
On video: IDF dismantled the underground infrastructure of Hamas's northern headquarters in Gaza from which kidnapped bodies were recovered 12.24.23/doc
The operational space in the Agent Activation Unit (504) in the IDF's intelligence wing is defined as a secret force for special and quiet missions around the world. An elite force that operates in the shadows. The operations that its fighters will rarely carry out are within the borders of the country and usually very far from home and in a way that exceeds all imagination. On October 7, The phones of the commanders of the operational area rang and the report passed from one to the other: one of the unit's fighters was wounded by gunfire from Hamas terrorists in the area of ​​the "Nova" festival in Ra'im. Commanders and fighters hurried to reach the unit's home base, organized themselves with combat equipment and drove south. On the way they received information that the unit's fighter was headed for by the Sheldag unit and evacuated by helicopter to the hospital. At a later stage in the war, the unit's members found and rescued the bodies of Ron Sherman, Nick Beiser, Elia Toledano, Ziv Dado and Eden Zakaria, who were kidnapped by Hamas and are now talking to Walla!.
Bringing the bodies back to Israel/IDF spokesman
"I make a decision that we don't stop and prepare for what's coming, but simply continue driving south. It has to be said that there wasn't a clear picture at the beginning. Me and 12 fighters are going to Kibbutz Bari," explained G (38), commander of a platoon of fighters in the operational area.
"We fought there from the morning until the night of Sunday. We moved from house to house and assisted in the rescue of about a hundred civilians. This is not a routine event at all for us. Until then, we are doing operations in other places. Our formations turned on us and we became a unit that responds to a terrorist incident."
With the sunset on October 8 and the realization that this is a very intense war that will unfold in several different arenas, the 504 fighters return to the unit's base and prepare for the command.
"We didn't work with Gaza until October 7. We worked in other sectors further away. I personally have never worked in Gaza. Take it wherever your head sails for what we are responsible for on a routine basis. I can't talk about it," explained the commander of the fighting division.
The commander of Unit 504 conducted a situation assessment and ultimately decided that the unit's operational space would throw and exhaust all of its combat power, intelligence resources and technological capabilities into the war.
The mission assigned to the operational space was to scan and locate selected Hamas sites at the head of the maneuvering forces that are a top priority for the intelligence community with an emphasis on the issue of prisoners and missing persons.
More in Walla!
It's so delicious and simple: a recipe for caramelized bananas
In collaboration with the Galil company
Members of Unit 504 in action/IDF spokesperson
The command passed down.
The commander of the 3rd fleet gathered his warriors and terrified them.
"We understand that Gaza knocked hard on our door. We received special missions to locate, scan, and bring civilians and soldiers home," he said.
Routine secret missions were halted, and the fighters of the combat cruises were prepared "for the next big thing in areas never before operated".
At record speed, they accumulated intelligence files, deepened the field cells and operational areas, created tools to shorten the process of gathering intelligence information in real time with the help of the unit's existing capabilities.
The first to maneuver deep into the Palestinian territory was Division 162, which was joined from the first moment by the fighters of the operational area.
"I can't expand, but our contribution is crucial. The capabilities that our unit is developing make a lot possible. Therefore, we will be part of this effort as long as there is a maneuver and it is in-depth," described G.
One of the turning points came during the fifth candle of Hanukkah on December 14.
The intelligence pointed to an area with an underground system where there is apparently a possibility that Hamas holds the bodies of prisoners.
Total darkness.
Every minute exchanges of fire in the area.
Air force bombs and tanks firing at anti-tank squads. The activity is carried out in a neighborhood in the heart of enemy territory, where at any moment a terrorist can emerge from a shaft in the area and attack the troops.
Eden Zakaria and Ziv Dado/IDF spokesman
There is someone at home who loves and waits
A series of operations carried out by two squadrons of fighters from 504, reduced the space where underground infrastructure could be found and deepened the understanding of the presence of an infiltration route to the infrastructure.
"This is a very complex operation. Nothing is clear about it. A very complex operation and we are supposed to reach the underground medium to extract bodies for identification purposes. We do not know what it is exactly and what to expect. We only know based on intelligence and logic. One thing is clear to us. In order to get the Our people out, we used all the capabilities at our disposal and the one who is leading this effort is the commander of the area, Col.
Everyone mobilized for this mission."
C describes the operations in an interview with Walla!. "We had two targeted operations to retrieve bodies.
The first on a Thursday candle and the second three days later.
Our unit is busy attacking the enemy and this is the first time that the unit is required for this type of activity.
There is no task more valuable than this task.
Rescuing the bodies of our people."
One of the fighters described the feeling on a personal level. "'Remember there is someone at home who loves him and is waiting for him and we are doing everything we can to get him out without knowing who it is,'" he described. "It was clear to us from the beginning To take a great risk also to bring civilians and soldiers to the grave of Israel.
This is the small point of light in all the darkness that started on October 7th.
In the end what is standing before your eyes is our brothers and sisters who deserve to be buried in the tomb of Israel.
We will do everything to bring others to burial so that the mother and wife and children will have a grave where they can cry and mourn."
From right to left: Ron Sherman, Elia Toledano and Nick Beiser/Official website, no
S. (28), the field officer who led the operation in the underground space to locate and physically extract the bodies of the soldiers, told Walla!: "We are busy every day solving complex operational problems. We are not brought to an activity that everyone knows how to do. Is there an operational challenge? We come and in the worlds Secrets are challenging. We have amazing capabilities and they surprise us every time. This time we were brought together with a very complex problem. I am proud of the solution we were able to bring to the IDF's toolbox and to success at the end.
" The state, starting with the first phone call about the injury of the unit member and then the realization that there are families who need help in the settlements in the Western Negev and ending with the rescue of the kidnapped bodies. "It was not a question at all.
We moved south quickly.
Then we talked about how to solve the problem.
In the first rescue?
I did not believe that we would be able to solve the problem.
The neighborhood where we operated was very complex and very dangerous.
There were forces all around and massive shooting.
Every minute that passes everyone is in awe until finally you realize that it is our people.
For me personally?
It was the Holy of Holies.
There is nothing more important than that.
We put the bodies on the stretchers, and covered them with the Israeli flag.
All the power went silent.
I won't say where it was.
We were very excited.
There were warriors with tears in their eyes.
We entered the area with our brothers and left with another of our brothers.
In my eyes, this is a tipping point.
I have done many operations over the years and in my eyes this was the most significant operation in my service.
To bring a brother and a sister and several more brothers after that from this lowest and darkest place literally.
There were very difficult moments there.
I will spare the plastic descriptions, the noise, the smell, the sight.
at the end?
There was half a battle ceremony.
We gave a prayer in our hearts, we clearly expressed our desire not to leave until we reach all our brothers and sisters."
As part of the sensitive and secretive activity of the operational space fighters in the 504 Agent Activation Unit, the senior officers of the unit make it clear that the prisoners and missing persons are placed in the first order of priority in front of their eyes. "Sometimes there was a feeling that We found a solution to the problem in the field and in the end it happened," stressed S. who told about the incident that strengthened him and his strength. "We went to the mother of the late Aden Zachariah. She lost the one dearest to her. Instead of strengthening her, she strengthened us. I pledge to all parents : We will give 110 percent to find the girls and boys. We will not stop and we will not leave until the last of the abductees. Our strength is the families of the abductees."
The funeral of Eden Zacharias
Eden Zacharia's funeral, Palmachim Cemetery/Walla!
S. also repeats the words he heard from the wife of RSV Ziv Dado. "She said that even if the result was not the expected result, the heart was not complete until the body was returned and there was no grave.
That is why this is one of the most valuable tasks and it is carried out under fire in combination with the 551st Brigade and the Yalam unit, including during the rescue stages. I told this to the commander of the unit: we will stay here until the last of the abductees returns. Wherever the maneuver goes, we will be 'all in'."
The commander of the cruise said towards the end of the conversation while he was receiving updates on what was happening in the field every moment: "It is important that everyone remember: we rescued our people who were forcibly kidnapped as civilians from a party, settlement or base. We will return them alive or dead to the grave in Israel. Only after you reach the depths of the terrain and go down, You understand how dark a place Gaza is. A kingdom of darkness. The menorah we lit there brought moral light. To some extent, we banish darkness in this place. Deep and far we pledged to bring all the boys and girls home. Despite the concealment efforts the enemy makes. Unit 504 spares no effort Not a single resource and not a single force for the needs of this mission."
